content:
Hi, I’ve just joined zulip.

I’m redoing most of the connection diagrams and will also create a page on the tools and techniques I’ve used so that future diagrams can be done easily by any editor and can have a similar style.

John

I've added the 2024 Basic User Manual Editors here https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:editors
We have another User-Editor joining us today Ties Brants.

Welcome Ties to the Editors Team.
All, I've asked a few questions at the top of Terry's version for Tracks for discussion regarding implementation.
https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:editor_manual:staging:track

Rick Gleason zei:

I've added the 2024 Basic User Manual Editors here https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:editors
We have another User-Editor joining us today Ties Brants.

Thanks Rick.
Not really sure where to start, but maybe I can do some proof reading? So if anyone has anything they would like me to check, please let me know.

@Ties Brants You could look at the Editor Manual 2024 Status and Progress page lower part where all the pages are listed.
There are a number of " Needs Review please" if you could review those in detail, correcting and pairing down verbosity in a professional way, then add your user name to the page with "Reviewed"

That would be helpful.

Rick Gleason zei:

Ties Brants You could look at the Editor Manual 2024 Status and Progress page lower part where all the pages are listed.
There are a number of " Needs Review please" if you could review those in detail, correcting and pairing down verbosity in a professional way, then add your user name to the page with "Reviewed"

That would be helpful.

Alright, I have started to read all the topics that have "Needs review please" but I struggle a little bit with how to review and edit. Because it seems to me that even the basic manual is giving so much information that t a lot of new users would get overwhelmed pretty quickly.

So my question is: has it been agreed that all the information that is in the basic manual should stay in the manual and all that needs to be done is present that information in the best possible way? Or is it also possible to suggest that some of the information that is currently there maybe does not need to be in the basis manual?

Or maybe a third option: Is it in idea to create a quick start guide, with really only the information you need to get Opencpn running with the basics?

Ties, there is a Quick Start Guide for New Users. The other parts of the Basic User Manual is for normal use and users. We also have an Advanced User Manual for Advanced user, which we have not edited and updated yet.

Please look at the Indexmenu Sidebar in OpenCPN Wiki
